lines.text: Say, Jack, she's so crooked they'll have to bury her in a trombone.
Hey Jack, can't you fix me up a little drink?
One more drink and you'll explode!
Well, get me it and get outta the way.
Look at the fun you're havin'!
Oh, you call that fun? Playing Santa Claus to a lot of baby doll gold diggers.
Oh, Jack, now they're all good little girls - every one of 'em.
Oh, just an 18 carat sap. Any chump in the world would know what they're after.
You insinuating that I'm a Sugar Daddy?
Someday you'll be glad when the right man comes along.
I know. That's what I try to tell myself. But, but most men won't have anything to do with a girl - with a girl that's good.
Oh, no kidding, I missed you so much, I started talkin' to your picture.
That's nothing. I wrote poetry to you.
You did? Let's see it!
I tore it up.
Oh, why?
For no rhyme or reason.
white, cool and nice.
Oh, thanks.
Some women are like red roses.
Yeah, well, you look out for those red roses, they have thorns you know.
Just for that I'm gonna give you a little kiss.
Why a little one?
You know, Mary, I'd be a good dancer if it wasn't for my feet.
Say, waiter, bring me the bad news, please.
Oh, are we going already?
Say, lay off me or I'll smack you so hard you'd think you were kissed by a million John Gilberts.
Whenever I get blue and discouraged, I just think of the wonderful advice you gave me on the train.
That's the spirit! Don't let 'em whip ya!
No, I'm not crazy, but, you are! You'd have to be to ditch a little gal like Mary and run around with that dizzy blonde sharpshooter.
Listen, chisler, I'm hep to you.
Oh, so you're a smart guy, huh?
I don't have to be smart to get wise to a gal like you.
Say, Jack, I'd lay off that porcupine - she's full of needles!
Oh, tell me you love me and you do as I ask.
Thanks Jack. Now everything's KO.
